title: Russian Opposition Leader Alexei Navalny Sentenced to Nine More Years in Prison
sub_head: The Kremlin critic’s supporters say Vladimir Putin ordered the case to silence him
body:
Russia’s leading opposition figure, Alexei Navalny, was sentenced to nine more years in prison on charges of fraud and contempt of court, in a case his supporters say was brought against him on the orders of President Vladimir Putin.
The antigraft campaigner, who has been a thorn in the Kremlin’s side for the past decade, was already serving a 3½ year sentence. He was jailed in February last year for violating parole related to an earlier fraud sentence he and his supporters say was politically motivated.
